Governing_Law: Section 6(5) of the Trade Marks Act
Procedural_Stage: Appeal after initial rejection by Opposition Board
Evidence_Assessment: Similarities in appearance, sound, and usage context; common use of 'NUTRI'; overlapping product types and markets
Burden_of_Proof: Appellant failed to prove no reasonable probability of confusion
Legal_Rule: Factors for determining trademark confusion include inherent distinctiveness, length of use, nature of wares, trade channels, and resemblance
Grounds_for_Claim: Potential confusion with registered trademark NUTRI-MAX
Review_Standard: Assessment of likelihood of confusion under statutory factors
Key_Evidence_Considered: Use of 'NUTRI' prefix, product overlap, market similarity, presentation of additional evidence on appeal
Standard_of_Proof: Preponderance of evidence / balance of probabilities
Defendant_Response: Opposition based on existing registration of NUTRI-MAX
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 6(5) of the Trade Marks Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Likelihood of confusion with prior registered mark
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Applications for NUTRI-BRAN and NUTRI-VITE registration
Governing_Rule: Section 6(5) of the Trade Marks Act
